contentrichtext.text: {{MedalTableTop}} {{MedalSport | Men's [[triathlon]]}} {{MedalCountry | {{FRA}} }} {{MedalCompetition|[[ITU Triathlon World Championships]]}} {{MedalGold| 2000 Perth | Individual}} {{MedalCountry | {{SUI}} }} {{MedalCompetition|[[ITU Triathlon World Championships]]}} {{MedalBronze| 2003 Queenstown | Individual}} {{MedalBottom}} '''Olivier Marceau''' (born January 30, 1973 in [[Fontenay-aux-Roses]], [[Hauts-de-Seine]]) is an athlete from [[France]], who competes in [[triathlon]]. A member of the ''Poissy Triathlon Club'' he competed at the first Olympic triathlon at the [[2000 Summer Olympics]]. He took seventh place with a total time of 1:49:18.03. Four years later, at the [[2004 Summer Olympics]], Marceau competed again. This time he competed on the [[Switzerland|Swiss]] team, placing eighth with a time of 1:52:44.36. ==References== *[http://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/ma/olivier-marceau-1.html sports-reference] {{Footer World Champions Triathlon Men}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Marceau, Olivier | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = French triathlete | DATE OF BIRTH = January 30, 1973 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Marceau, Olivier}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Fontenay-aux-Roses]] [[Category:French triathletes]] [[Category:Olympic triathletes of France]] [[Category:Olympic triathletes of Switzerland]] [[Category:Swiss triathletes]] [[Category:Triathletes at the 2000 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Triathletes at the 2004 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Triathletes at the 2008 Summer Olympics]] {{Switzerland-sport-bio-stub}} {{triathlon-bio-stub}}
